reviewText: My son (3)saw the Treasure Buddies and fell in LOVE with these guys.  I bought this one to see if it was a fluke or what...but no he loves this one also!Good thing is even parents like these.  They are cute and not at all corney!I had to make him watch the movie at first as it seems to always have 'people' in these at first to lay the ground work and my son doesnt want that.  But after a couple minutes he was glued!

Title: Air Buddies

reviewText: Air Buddies is a 2006 Disney direct-to-DVD feature film that was inspired by the Air Bud franchise. Directed by Robert Vince, this films tells the tale of Buddy(Tom Everett Scott, That Thing You Do), now retired, and his wife Molly(Molly Shannon, Saturday Night Live)became the proud parents of five cute and playful puppies called the Buddies. Each Buddy has their own unique personality, and their own style of getting into trouble. When a evil animal poacher plans to steal Buddy and Molly, it is up to the Buddies to save their Mom and Dad. Also starring Richard Karn(Home Improvement, Family Feud), Wallace Shawn(Toy Story 3, The Cosby Show), Debra Jo Rupp(That 70's Show) the late Michael Clarke Duncan(Daredevil, The Green Mile) and the late Don Knotts(Three's Company, The Don Knotts Show)in his very final performance, this spinoff of the Air Bud movies is a delight. The special features includes Buddy facts, bloopers, and sneak peeks of other Disney favourites on DVD. Air Buddies is a heartwarming and hilarious start of a series of soon-to-be Disney classics! :)
Title: Air Buddies

Title: Air Buddies

reviewText: AIR BUDDIES is another take on the longstanding Air Bud franchise Disney DVD has pumped over over the last few years.  Air Bud was a dog (a Golden Retriever, no less) that could play baseball, soccer, football, volleyball, and basketball.  It only stands to reason that his offspring would be simply amazing as well.  This DVD tells their stories, and there are a lot of laughs along the way.Patrick Cranshaw and Don Knotts were two of Hollywood's finest character actors, and they were good in this film.  They were joined by Richard Karn and Cynthia Stevenson, also veteran character actors and second bananas in top-rated shows like HOME IMPROVEMENT and DEAD LIKE ME.The movie starts out with a bang, bringing the viewers into Air Bud's life as a dad with five incorrigable puppies that share his love of sports and his ability.  However, the puppies are too much for the family, as shown when they gang up on the nanny and tie her up.  At the same time, a villain sets his sights on their famous father, intending to bag Air Bud and sell him to a millionaire's spoiled son.  When the puppies run away from home to escape being separated and given away, they're used by the bad guys as bait.  Then, when their parents are dognapped, it's up to the puppies to save the day.The humor is great, definitely jokes and physical comedy that keeps the younger viewers in stitches while providing an entertaining romp for the adults in the crowd.  This is one of those DVDs to buy for road trips in the family van because kids will want to watch this one over and over.
Title: Air Buddies

reviewText: Those puppies are awesome so cute! They all have their own little ways and really make this movie a must for anyone. Not just families, this will make anyone laugh.

reviewText: A couple of years ago I purchased "Air Bud" for my little great nephew. When I saw this one advertised on tv, I knew I had to get it for him as he loved the first one. He adores it he says! He is 6 years old and it seems this is the perfect movie for that age group. Besides, who wouldn't love talking puppies? Get this movie for your children or for yourselves. I promise it will be entertaining to the whole family.

reviewText: Received it in good shape and  playable. Thanks for sending it as promptly as you did. Turns out I have another one of these. But that is okay. I used one for a present.
Title: Air Buddies

reviewText: If I could split my review, I would give it three stars from an adult's perspective but--based on the reactions of my sons (9 & 11 years old)--five from a kid's.  And I don't think it's just because we own a golden puppy.Unlike the previous movies, the dogs talk in this one.  A couple of the puppies are really annoying when they talk (and will sound incredibly dated in about ... well, now), but the new conceit works pretty well for freshing up the series.The best part of the movie, though, was the pleasant surprise of hearing Don Knotts' voice one more time.  He voices a (what else) deputy dog and it's like getting to listen to Barney all over again.  Half expected him to call someone "Ange"!Buy it for the kids, listen to it for the Knotts!
summary: Worth it Just for Don Knotts
Title: Air Buddies

reviewText: Fun story.  Bought this when I was providing after-school care for an autistic child.  I probably enjoyed it more than he did because he was unable to focus on anything for more than a few minutes.
